definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
coin/money/CL:筆|笔[bi3]/unit of weight, one tenth of a tael 兩|两[liang3]

sentences.english: What do you do when people ask you for money?
sentences.chinese: 有人向你要錢的時候你會怎麼辦？

sentences.english: The robber held up the store cashier at gun-point for money.
sentences.chinese: 搶徒用槍威脅商店收費員，向他要錢。

sentences.english: Ignoring a homeless person who asks for money.
sentences.chinese: 街上一個無家可歸的人向你要錢，你揚長而去。

sentences.english: A laboring man needs bread and butter, and cash to pay the rent.
sentences.chinese: 勞動者需要麪包和黃油，也要錢付房租。

sentences.english: But you can't always ask your parents for help.
sentences.chinese: 但是你不能總向父母要錢。

sentences.english: But of course that's where the money is.
sentences.chinese: 不過，當然這些都要錢的。

sentences.english: A beggar came up to us and ask for money.
sentences.chinese: 一個乞丐走過來向我們要錢。

sentences.english: I don't know anymore what you really think of me…
sentences.chinese: 就有如我姐或弟向我要錢我也從來不會深入追究用途。

sentences.english: “You’re standing here asking me for money, ” my father said.
sentences.chinese: “你站在這裏向我要錢花，”我爸爸說。

sentences.english: It is not comme il faut for a gentleman to be constantly asking for money.
sentences.chinese: 對一位紳士來說，經常向別人要錢是不合適的。

sentences.english: Mary was leading up to a request for money with his kind words.
sentences.chinese: 瑪莉說了一些客氣話是爲開口要錢作準備。

sentences.english: I think it's ok to ask friends and family for money.
sentences.chinese: 你認爲向朋友或家人要錢或借錢是非常正常的事。

sentences.english: Beautiful beautiful decision is married Li Xiaobao, the condition is he cannot look for Wang Youzhi to want money.
sentences.chinese: 秀秀決定嫁給李小寶，條件是他不能找王有志要錢。

sentences.english: When she asks you for money, the other one dares to help you hit her, that's enough.
sentences.chinese: 當她向你要錢時，另一個敢幫你打她，這樣就夠了。

sentences.english: Peter, freeze, your money or your life?
sentences.chinese: 皮特，不許動，要錢還是要命？

sentences.english: He refused to take anything for fixing the TV-set.
sentences.chinese: 他修理了電視機不肯要錢。

definition: daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
variant of 佣錢|佣钱[yong4 qian5]
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to go abroad/to leave the country/emigration
